info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Jackson County through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sylva, or over Webster, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sylva, Cullowhee, Webster, Dillsboro, Savannah, Tuckasegee, and the Blue Ridge Parkway between Balsam Gap and the Black Balsam Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
